flipcard.question: If you say that someone is ___, you are being critical of them because they are unwilling to meet new people or to consider new ideas.
flipcard.answer: But you should not use this as an excuse to become insular and hide behind your phone.

flipcard.question: Something that is ___ can be understood.
flipcard.answer: The language of Darwin was intelligible to experts and non-experts alike.

flipcard.question: Something has ___ value if it is valuable because of its basic nature or character, and not because of its connection with other things.
flipcard.answer: The paintings have no intrinsic value except as curiosities.

flipcard.question: Something that is ___ can be achieved.
flipcard.answer: It is unrealistic to believe perfection is an attainable goal.

flipcard.question: A ___ search, examination, or investigation is done extremely carefully and thoroughly.
flipcard.answer: Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

flipcard.question: To ___ something that has been said or reported means to provide evidence or information that supports it.
flipcard.answer: I had access to a wide range of documents which corroborated the story.

flipcard.question: You use __ to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land which they have had for a long time.
flipcard.answer: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.

flipcard.question: A ___ area of land is uneven and covered with rocks, with few trees or plants.
If something or someone ___ a force or action, they survive it or do not give in to it.

flipcard.question: when first seen; as a first impression (phrase)
flipcard.answer: At first blush it seems odd that MPs were so exercised over a motion.

flipcard.question: If you ___ someone, you do or say something to make them stop feeling angry.
flipcard.answer: 'I didn't mean to upset you,' Agnew said in a placating voice.

flipcard.question: If you are ___ of someone or something, you do not like or respect them at all.
flipcard.answer: The government was being contemptuous of the view expressed by the Commons.

flipcard.question: If you are ___, you feel very happy and proud about something you have done.

flipcard.question: ___ is a feeling of great happiness and excitement about something that has happened.

flipcard.question: A ___ is a loyal worker or supporter of an organization, especially a political party.

flipcard.question: An ___ person acts in a brave way.
flipcard.answer: It was an impossibly intrepid explorer that expanded our knowledge of Mars.
